Text: The nineties were characterized by a phenomenon I call bitchification. Any women covered by the news was maligned, objectified, dismissed, often with the word bitch
we have so much to gain from a fresh look or the very least an honest appraisal of the nineties. We must or we risk repeating the mistakes of the past.
The stories of nineties women have become sexist mythology. A problematic hsitory, that saps women of their power, just as it was intended to do.
We are still experiencing the after shocks. The Clinton impeachement scandal, then covered as the Monica Lewinsky scandal, cast Lewinsky as a blow job queen.
During the OJ Simpson trial, lawyer Marcia Clark was framed as an unqualified teenager and a bad mom
Anita Hill testifies that supreme court nominie Clarence Thomas sexually harrased her. Hill was called a scorned women and a litle bit nutty and a litle bit slutty
The media revolution of the twenty four hour news cycle focused on these storeis and insatiable audience followed. Women quickly became renetless content.
Lorena Bobbitt cut off her husbands penis, after alleged years of rape and abuse.
The press mocked her. Celebrated him and covered her as a perpetrator, not a victim
History has remembered these women negatively. The medias bitchification didn't treat all women equally.
While white women face sexism, black women face racism and sexism.
Black women were portrayed as jezebels and sapphires. Hypersexual, angry or threatening, because of their race.
The media that bitchified women back then and continue to bitchify women today, must be held accountable.
This is an ongoing process. Progress is that women more are telling their own stories today.
A new documentary called Lorena recognizes that she is a survivor of domestic abuse and an immigrant women.
A hearting biopic, humanizes her by juxtaposing her accomplishment, with hardship she suffered
Today we are faced with a very differnet media revolution, the social media revolution.
Through the lens of metoo and timesup, we can see the harm that media caused.
And while the internet can be a harsh place for women, it is also home to supportive spaces for survivors, viral campaigns to fight injustice.
It helps us see, that we are not alone. Others are fighting with us.
Recent laws passed by the indian parliament are set to irrevocably damage indian democracy and constitutional framework.
Government revoked the autonomy of provinces of Jammu and Kashmir. Phone and internet are cut off this instance. Key political leaders are detained.
This paves the way for hindu indian settlements in kashmir to change the demographic set up of the region
Since its inception, Israel has used jewish only settlements, to supplant local palestinian commuinities that are being expelled from their land.
Indias new citizenship law grants minorities form neighbouring countries citizenship as long as they are not muslims
The law of return, a central pillar of Israel's apartheid regime grants only jew citizenship, but bars even palestinian refugees right to return.
Agriculture, universities and bollywood have become testing grounds and propoganda spaces
Our opressors are connected, but our movements united can defeat them.
The white british population has decreased by six hundered thousand. While the minority population has increased by one twenty million. Yes lads, we are winning.
Will the minister today, stand up in this place and rule out extending the cashless welfare card.
Sadly those numbers are likely to go up, before they come down.
Some will start to think like there is a double standards in this country, where law enforcement is concerned.

In less than two minutes, we are gonna teach you about the racist history of so called right to work. What it is, where it exists and how we can defeat it.
It's primary purpose is to destroy labour union and the freedom of collective bargaining.
Dividing workers by race has been essential to thwarting labour organizing efforts since the days of slavery.
The biggest proponent of the right to work was an anti semitic, white supremacist, corporate lobbyist, named vance muse.
Mr. Muse was terrified, labour organizers in the south might get balck and white workers to join the same unions.
A number of states have gone so far as to even make it right to work a part of their state constitution.
Where ever these laws exist, wages are lower, benefits for workers are worse, job-site safety and worker protections are poor and workers freedom is nearly not existent.
In our glorious fight for civil rights, we must guard against being pulled by false slogans such as right to work.
But we can do more than just play defence. We can and must go on the offensive. By passing the passing the PRO act for example, we could overwrite right to work laws all across the country.
Right to work was racist in its origins and it attacks on public sector unions, which are strongly represented by workers of color remain fundamentally racist.
Let's put right to work into the dustbin of history, where it belongs, once and for all

first of all look, I don't know nothing about these but everything I know about these people, I learnt from watching Netflix on weed .
Ok, which I probably wouldn't have done if I had understood that it was based on reality when my wife started the show.
My way through the first episode and I am looking at her like, so there ain't, there ain't no dragons in this or nothing.
I love British stuff, the people, the accent, the cat shows and all that but I never mess with the monarchies.
I mean they are equivalent of congress is called the house of lords and the house of commons.
They might as well call it fencing house in a tank chamber, its wild and everybody just goes with it.
They still got earls and dukes and stuff, and we got earls and dukes over here but its good old boys and mayonnaise brands.
I don't understand where these posh motherfuckers get off some times you all, cause if you ask me, the British aristocracy has some serious white trash red neck tendencies.
All the negative stereotypes about my people are true about them, think about it, they got shitty teeth, they are always fucking their cousins, they don't want people up in their business.
You can never tell they got a dam job or not, they don't like friends shit, they love standing in fields and shooting at birds and stuff.
Look, I am obviously kidding around but seriously fuck these people, at this point the queen is just a little old lady, who is real good at looking precious while holding a tiny purse in a picture.
But, if any institution on planet earth has out lived its usefulness, its the British monarchy.
No matter what, I will always have nothing but love for the UK and its people.
I have been very privileged to meet, met a number of the members of the royal family and I would set straight out, they are absolutely not racist.
there is absolutely no doubt in my mind that our royal family is not racist.

But she said, what we have to look at, the royal family is not just a bunch of people, they are the royal house hold.
There is the network that surround them, that keeps them going, that props them up, that tells them you go here you go there and maybe that needs a clear out.
Its a whole lot of people, and maybe we need to look at that or that needs to be looked at a lot deeper and that's what I would suggest.
I honestly don't understand what is going on in America, I truly don't.
We have headline after headline after headline, progressive scholars calling for the dumming down of education.
Students shouldn't be told to strive for the right answer in math, because that's white supremacist.
Students shouldn't  be told that they got the answer wrong  because that's a toxic environment
In English class, you know, students shouldn't be marked down for improper spelling and grammar and punctuations because its mean and cruel and it comes from these white supremacist places.
I truly don't understand, because how are we gonna get to mars, how are we gonna cure cancer, how are we gonna discover new technologies.
When we are telling our kids, don't learn how to spell and don't worry about math because its racist, like we have got things really backwards in this country right now.
This anti racism clap chap that's being pressed that, you know that grading is racist and just gives credit for your hard work.
That's actually racist in itself, because what it's telling students of color is that you can't, you can't do this work.
You are capable of doing this work, we have to go easy on you, they are actually setting the bar lower for these kids, instead of calling them to greatness, that's what America has become.
And I say that anti racist education is actually racist.

That's not the answer and that's a trick, we need to be on guard against that.

So, by design, the monarchy can't claim to not be institutionally racist when that is what actually gave that its relevance.

There is always the question about reservation, why is nothing is being done to ensure reservation in parliament.
This is a subject that's been  brought up in nineteen ninety six, we are still talking about it.
I don't have to mention that you know all our representatives here are from different political parties, I saw how all of you stood here hugged each other, so I know you all have that close bond.
Beyond the politics, why is it that we are so hesitant on going ahead and ensuring the most basic step of reservation.

So joining me now, one of the incredible women who put her life at risk to protect this country and that is Major M J Hegar.
Thank you so much major, I really appreciate you joining us to see me and thank you for your service. So you are a women and a veteran, what was going through your mind when you heard those comments.
Yeah its difficult, a couple things went through my mind one, clearly he has never served, you know I was involved with the fight to open ground combat jobs to women.
And we found a lot of times, then in my own combat experience I found that, the people who were the loudest against it were the people who have never served in combat.
I would say that, those who have experience, you know with the bullets flying and really in the mix, don't care what color you are, what gender you are, who you love, what your politics are.
Competence is everything, can this person cover my six, that's all we care about.
By the way we don't send, you know 8-9 months pregnant women into combat anyway, the flight suits are because people are serving in a job and the flight suit is a indicator of that job.
Its also something that you earn through going through pilot training and that type of thing.
What we find is these people who see these women doing these job and are threatened by it and think, gosh I couldn't do that, they feel the need to hold us down and pull us down.
But luckily we have so many women, men and women, but we do have women standing bravely on the front line and support roles, keeping us safe and I sleep better at night knowing that.
Yeah, I knew a lot of men, civilian men and women who support you as well, we just want you to know that.

When the reality is, he was called out for his sexist remarks by soldiers in top brass, now he is playing the victim.
Yeah, its funny right. We can't say culture is always bad until they do it to us.
You know, something that's extraordinary to me, and is actually really inspiring to me is, is that its pretty rare for top brass to make their opinions vocal.

A lot of times you know, in the military we are raised to believe that you know either you don't have opinions or you keep them to yourself, you certainly don't get involved in anything that looks political.
So I'm very heartened, I don't think that this was spontaneous you know, support from senior leaders, I think it was an organized you know, people got the ok to go ahead and make their voices heard.
I mean that says something to me, about the future of our military, the direction we are going, the fact that we are taking things serious. We have a serious culture problem in the military.
We have sexual harassment, sexual assault, and we are not gonna fix those things until the top brass are freed up to express these types of opinions and show support.

And really draw line in the sand and lets make no mistake, these are the values of our military. We value a strong military, it is a military effectiveness issue to be able to employee all assets in the best ways that we can.

Explain why maternity uniforms or flight suits you said, they are so important because its a, it represents the job you are doing but explain to us why they are so important.
Yeah you know what, I have also find it hypocritical is that women used to be criticized for leaving the military when they got pregnant.

They used to be forced to and then they were given the option to get out of there when they were pregnant which some women get criticized for and now it seems we are getting criticized for staying in.
I think of women, you know I am a mom but I didn't have kids before I deployed.
The flight suit is a symbol of what you have accomplished, you are given the flight suit when you, you know get your wings and that type of thing.
So, to put us in a different uniform when we are pregnant kind of signifies that we are getting taken out of the team.
So I think its right that they have maternity flight suits, its not because women are flying, you know at that size, that stage in pregnancy.
It's not because we are jumping into trenches and fox holes, its because we are still valid, valued members of the team.

I think that I have said before is that, white women grow up being taught that they can trade somebody else's bodily autonomy and safety to secure their own proximity to power.
But the use of that proximity to power grants us is the ability to never have to grow, it insulates white women in this little bubble where we are innocent.
And how could you hold us accountable for this, we are just little babies, but that space is dependent upon our youth and beauty.
The problem with ageing is that, a lot of it is about growth, it's about leaning into your power, it is about learning what you are capable of.

This is why this is a white millennial problem for the most part, we were given the expectation that we would always be fine that we would always be relevant that nothing could ever really touch us and we never have to be accountable but it actually turns out, we have to grow now.
We can't just keep existing and perpetuating these power structures that already exists, we have to fix it now.
